function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Timing of interventions for mitigation and suppression strategies","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Delay in seeing the impact of interventions on hospitalised case numbers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective mitigation strategies may lead to overwhelming the healthcare system capacity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social and economic effects of epidemic suppression measures will be profound","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty of long-term success of epidemic suppression strategy","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assuming that each intervention has the same effect on the reproduction number across countries and over time.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on data from countries with more advanced epidemics and earlier interventions, such as italy and spain.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High level of uncertainty in estimating the effective reproduction number, rt, in italy around the time of lockdown.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wide credible interval estimates for the reproduction number","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large epidemics of covid-19 in europe","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-pharmaceutical interventions vary between countries","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High 𝑅 𝑡 leading to uncontrolled epidemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relaxation of control measures leading to virus spread","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited testing capacity leading to biased view of infection trends.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on reported deaths for estimating infection rates.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Strong assumption of intervention efficacy across different countries.","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited testing capacity leading to underestimation of true infections","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Timing of interventions and speed of implementation varying among countries","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data on the impact of interventions and uncertainty in model estimates","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher proportion of the population infected in spain 15.0%","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in initial reproduction numbers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large changes in rt in response to non-pharmaceutical interventions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in reproduction numbers rt across countries","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to conclude whether interventions are sufficient to drive rt below 1","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating intervention impact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Statistical impossibility of determining the greatest effect of interventions","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability of the model without interventions to capture recent trends in deaths","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High level of under-ascertainment of infections due to focus on testing in hospital settings rather than in the community.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low percentage of individuals infected, with an attack rate on average of 4.9%.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Traveling and non-necessary social contacts advised against by health directive.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential for misinterpretation of study findings leading to inappropriate urban planning decisions","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weighting scheme not reflective of occupants’ priorities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Weighting scheme subject to revision","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Subjective bias in ieq voting module","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Passive acceptance of ratings leading to biased feedback","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor air and CO2 concentration affect occupant satisfaction.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower acceptance for high CO2 concentrations in building type A compared to building type B, leading to potential dissatisfaction and discomfort for occupants.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to self-isolation and quarantine measures","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Initial approach towards social distancing and self-isolation may not have been sufficient to prevent a high death count","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High number of overseas arrivals during lockdown may have contributed to the spread of the virus","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relaxation of social distancing measures may lead to increased transmission of covid-19","category":"Control and Prevention Measures risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of guidelines","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Home as a place where social harms are stored and amplified during lockdowns","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on social inequality, health, and housing.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unexplored concepts such as social murder, ontological security, and home un-making.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of social harm perspective as a building block for housing studies.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High dependence on migrant workers in the construction sector","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased labor working hours without addressing labor concerns","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequities faced by different social groups in urban settings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of socioeconomic factors on pandemic spread","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
